AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	4	789	948	FIFA secretary general Jerome Valcke said that FIFA's position is that a player suspended for 12 months should be allowed to resume training after nine months.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	6	1094	1266	Since the beginning of January, the world anti-doping code requires elite athletes to give notice of their location at a chosen one-hour period each day, seven days a week. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0014	7	1276	1384	FIFA had contended that players should be subject to testing when with their teams, but not when on holiday.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	10	1390	1557	Long a lightning rod in the bitter US culture war over abortion, Tiller, 67, over the years had been picketed, bombed and shot in the arms, before being killed Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	11	1567	1740	Tiller's was one of only three clinics in the United States that perform late- term abortions, which are performed on fetuses that would be viable outside the mother's womb. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0015	12	1750	1888	Late-term abortions are legal in Kansas if two independent physicians agree that the mother could suffer irreparable harm by giving birth.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	11	2097	2209	Under the plan, the bondholders would obtain the rights to buy an extra 15 percent of GM's stock at a low price. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	12	2210	2330	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0026	17	3024	3171	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	0	58	110	New therapies to treat breast, lymph cancer: studies 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	1	194	397	New therapies developed following groundbreaking clinical trials appear to effectively target breast cancer and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, according to research unveiled Sunday at a major cancer conference. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	2	407	576	The first therapy targeting the capacity of cancer cells to repair themselves shows promise in treating breast cancer, according to results of two small clinical trials. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	3	586	817	The new agent, especially adept at targeting cancers that are most difficult to cure, neutralizes an enzyme called PARP (poly-ADP-ribose-polymerase) and prevents it from playing its usual role in repairing the DNA of damaged cells. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	4	827	957	Like healthy cells, cancerous cells employ PARP to regenerate themselves after they have been damaged by chemo-therapy treatments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	5	967	1092	The studies examined whether breast cancers are more susceptible to chemotherapy when the PARP enzymes have been neutralized. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	6	1102	1211	The first clinical trial was conducted with 116 women suffering from so-called triple negative breast cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	7	1221	1340	These involve fast-spreading tumors that account for 15 percent of the 170,000 annual cases worldwide of breast cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	8	1350	1529	Some of the cases were treated with chemotherapy and a PARP inhibitor called BSI-201 made by the firm BiPar Sciences, a US affiliate of the French-owned laboratory Sanofi-Aventis. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	9	1539	1596	The rest of the group was treated only with chemotherapy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	10	1606	1872	After six months, about 62 percent of the patients treated with BSI-201 combined with chemotherapy showed a comparative clinical improvement of 21 percent over the control group, said Joyce O'Shaughnessy, of the Baylor-Charles Sammons cancer center in Dallas, Texas. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	11	1882	2015	She presented the results of the study at a conference of the American Society of Clinical Oncology this weekend in Orlando, Florida. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	12	2025	2291	The women treated with BSI-201 survived 9.2 months on average, including 6.9 months in which the cancer did not spread, compared to an average survival of 6.9 months and 3.3 months in which the cancer was in check for those who were treated solely with chemotherapy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	13	2301	2426	The second clinical study involved 54 women suffering from advanced breast cancer linked to the gene mutation BRCA1 or BRCA2. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	14	2427	2529	They were treated with the PARP blocker Olaparib made by the Anglo-Swedish pharmaceutical AstraZenica. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	15	2530	2557	There was no control group. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	16	2567	2739	The test showed that 40 percent of the patients who took the drug experienced a reduction in their tumors, said Andrew Tutt, a cancer specialist at Kings College in London. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	17	2749	2941	In another study presented here researchers examined a vaccine on patients over eight years that targeted follicular non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, a particularly aggressive form of lymphatic cancer. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	18	2951	3189	The study found that patients who received the BiovaxID vaccine experienced on average disease-free survival of approximately 44 months, compared to about 30 months for patients who received a control vaccine -- an increase of 47 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	19	3199	3351	The BiovaxID vaccine is patient-specific, in that each dose must be individually manufactured from tissue obtained from a patient's own cancerous tumor. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	20	3361	3595	"With this vaccine, we've now moved into an era where we can safely use a patient's immune system to effectively fight follicular lymphoma and enhance the response to conventional chemotherapy" said lead study author Stephen Schuster. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0030	21	3605	3805	"Because this vaccine uniquely recruits the patient's immune system to seek and destroy only tumor B-cells, this approach may be applicable to the treatment of other B-cell lymphomas," Schuster added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	0	58	105	Nigeria troops destroy militant camp: spokesman 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	1	178	348	Nigeria's army said Sunday it had destroyed a rebel camp in southern Rivers state as part of its campaign to end years of violence and kidnappings in the oil-rich region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	2	358	566	"The troops of Joint Task Force (JTF) have located and destroyed a militants' camp close to Buguma creek in Rivers State after a fierce exchange of fire with the militants," army spokesman Rabe Abubakar said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	3	576	748	"The troops of JTF were fired at from the militants' camp over night and the security outfit has no choice but to locate and destroy the camp," he said in an e-mail to AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	4	758	887	He said the military would get "rid of the criminals who are bent on causing unnecessary tension and apprehension in the region". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0031	5	897	980	Abubakar said the military also recovered some arms and ammunition during the raid.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	0	58	103	First president of Guinea-Bissau dies aged 78 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	1	177	355	Luis Cabral, the first post-independence president of Guinea-Bissau who was later toppled in a military coup, has died of a heart attack in Lisbon, officials announced on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	2	356	366	He was 78. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	3	376	571	"It is with shock and sadness that the government and people of Guinea-Bissau have learnt of the loss of one of their most illustrious sons, Luis Cabral," the government announced in a statement. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	4	581	719	The government was to hold an emergency session to organise preparations for a three-day period of national mourning, the statement added.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	6	907	1145	Cabral was a half-brother of Amilcar Cabral, long-time leader of the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde (PAIGC) liberation movement, who was assassinated in 1973 -- the year before Guinea-Bissau attained its independence from Portugal. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	7	1155	1306	Cabral ruled in Guinea-Bissau until he was overthrown in a coup led by "First Commissar", or prime minister, Joao Bernardo Vieira on November 14, 1980. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	8	1316	1440	After his ouster, Cabral was imprisoned for six months before being released after the intervention of the Cuban government. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	9	1450	1614	He then spent most of the rest of his life in exile in Portugal, although he did make a brief return to Guinea-Bissau 1999 after Vieira was toppled in another coup. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0035	10	1624	1856	News of his death comes less than three months after Vieira, who returned to power in 2005 elections, was assassinated by soldiers in the hours after a bomb attack which claimed the life of the West African country's military chief. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	0	58	120	British PM says won't quit as poll predicts Euro election rout 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	1	194	393	British Prime Minister Gordon Brown insisted Sunday he would not quit despite a scandal over MPs expenses and dire poll ratings for his ruling Labour Party before crunch European and local elections. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	2	403	603	He said the expenses furore, which has shown how lawmakers claimed from the public purse for everything from moat cleaning to a duck island, was "appalling" and "offends everything that I believe in". 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	3	613	728	Every member of parliament would be forced to account for all their expenses from the last four years, he promised.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	6	1087	1271	It suggested Labour would come third in the elections for the European Parliament with just 17 percent, behind David Cameron's Conservatives and the smaller centrist Liberal Democrats. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	7	1281	1466	Even more damagingly, it suggested Labour would also come third in a general election with just 22 percent of the vote -- the worst Brown's party has done in an opinion poll since 1987. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0036	8	1476	1617	Some 54 percent of those polled thought Labour had been worst affected by the expenses scandal, compared to 13 percent for the Conservatives.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	0	58	115	Football: Betis relegated after Osasuna, Sporting heroics 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	1	189	385	Real Betis were relegated from the Spanish top-flight on a heart-breaking final Sunday of the season, drawing 1-1 at home to Valladolid while relegation rivals Osasuna and Sporting Gijon both won. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	2	395	648	Betis started a point above the drop zone knowing a win would keep them in the top tier but Sporting's 2-1 comeback win over Recreativo Huelva coupled with Osasuna's sensational 2-1 victory against nine-man Real Madrid saw them relegated with 42 points. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	3	658	875	Betis, who are based in the southern city of Seville, were last relegated in 2000 but immediately won promotion the following season and have been in the first division since 2001, finishing as high as fourth in 2005. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	4	885	996	"It is a sad day because once again the football gods weren't on our side," said Betis coach Jose Maria Nogues. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	5	997	1071	"Betis now have to get back in the top division for its fans and history." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	6	1081	1247	Getafe, who drew 1-1 with Racing Santander, also finished on 42 points but stayed up on goal difference while Valladolid's draw at Betis was enough to keep them safe. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	7	1257	1423	It was particularly tough for Betis duo Sergio Garcia and Ricardo Oliveira, who cost a combined 19 million euros after being relegated with Real Zaragoza last season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	8	1433	1567	At half-time Sporting Gijon, trailing Recre 1-0, were set to be relegated but came back to win 2-1 and secure their top-flight status. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	9	1577	1738	Sporting had spent a decade in the second division before winning promotion last season and defied the odds to stay up with Luis Moran scoring a dramatic winner. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	10	1748	1838	"It was an agonising game that felt like seven days," said Sporting coach Manolo Preciado.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	13	2065	2232	However, Jose Camacho's men battled back, equalising through Jaroslav Plasil before Juanfran smashed a stunning volley past Iker Casillas to keep them in the division. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	14	2242	2314	"We reached our target although it was a bit last minute," said Camacho. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	15	2315	2482	"It is clear that Osasuna need to reconstruct the squad a bit because for the past two seasons we have been fighting for survival on the final weekends of the season." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	16	2492	2601	Michel Salgado and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar were both sent off for Real, who crashed to a fifth successive defeat.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0039	18	2764	2986	Tamudo, the club's all-time top-scorer and an icon after spending his entire career at Espanyol, scored twice in the first half and completed his treble with a 56th-minute penalty to give the Montjuic the perfect send-off.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	0	58	114	Golf: Frenchman Cevaer shocks field to win European Open 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	1	188	313	France's Christian Cevaer, ranked a lowly 449th in the world, shocked a strong field to win the European Open here on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	2	323	610	After four rounds of golf that saw 45 changes of the lead, the 39-year-old Frenchman, who has failed to make the top-30 in his last 15 starts and whose only previous Tour victory was the 2004 Spanish Open, beat England's Steve Webster, Scot Gary Orr and Spaniard Alvaro Quiros by a shot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	3	620	809	His winning total of 281, seven under par, was 13 strokes more than Ross Fisher took on the same London Club course last year - and his 74 was the highest last round by a winner all season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	4	819	1047	But while Webster and Quiros both became more victims of the 471-yard last when tied for the lead - both carved their drives into the crowd, with Quiros hitting spectators with his first and second shots - Cevaer kept his nerve. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	5	1057	1281	During the week the par four played to an average of nearly 4.7, with 154 bogeys, 48 doubles and 26 sevens or worse, but Cevaer parred it the first two days, birdied it in the third round and finished with the par he needed. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	6	1291	1376	"I'm not a long player, but I used my utility club and it worked out great," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	7	1386	1486	"I made a point that no matter what happened just enjoy my golf, enjoy my skills and hang in there." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	8	1496	1647	He played the front nine in 39 and did not have a birdie until the long 15th, but the problems meant that it brought him back into a share of top spot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	9	1657	1801	And then three closing pars were good enough to give him the 300,000 pounds first prize - easily the biggest of his 16-year professional career. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	10	1811	1984	At 196th on the "Race to Dubai" money list entering the week he would have been delighted just to secure his card for next season, but now he has a five-year Tour exemption. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	11	1994	2002	bur/lp09 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	12	2012	2201	Overnight leader Jeev Milkha Singh of India was still at the top of the leaderboard in the European Open after windy conditions took a toll of scores at the London Club in Kent on Saturday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	13	2211	2342	Singh shot a one under par 71 to leave him in the joint lead with France's Christian Cevaer who went one better with a round of 70. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	14	2352	2578	But hot on their heels was 20-year-old rising star Rory McIlroy who caught the eye with a four-under-par 68 that saw the Northern Irishman close to within three shots of the leading duo after he'd been in 25th place overnight. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	15	2588	2679	Alongside McIlroy in joint third place were England's Chris Wood and Spain's Alvaro Quiros. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	16	2689	2895	Singh, the world number 39, defied the conditions to cover the final six holes in a superb four under par on a day where Spain's Sergio Garcia was one of several players to finish with a triple bogey seven. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	17	2905	3012	Before his round Singh said it was vital for the progress of golf in India that it became an Olympic sport. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	18	3022	3125	"Golf not being an Olympic sport we have not been getting any funding from the government," Singh said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	19	3135	3362	"Hopefully in October it does and I think what happens after that is the government is going to allocate land in each and every city to have a public driving range so that a normal human being can go there and try a hand at it. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	20	3372	3428	"That's when it's going to be really big in our country. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	21	3429	3553	It's the fastest- growing sport in our country, but it's the only way this game is going to get famous and close to cricket. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	22	3563	3661	"Our population is more than a billion and I'm sure there's going to be a lot of talent out there. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	23	3671	3782	"I don't think there's a public driving range in our country and there's only one public golf course right now. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	24	3783	3805	Everything is private. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	25	3815	3957	"I remember there were a lot of good players when I was growing up who just didn't take it up - they just went back to the parents' business." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	26	3967	4153	Last week McIlroy shot 65 at Wentworth before falling back in the final round and it appears injury may have been a factor, although it seems as if he is getting close to finding a cure. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	27	4163	4334	McIlroy, who revealed he'd been struggling with a "little niggle" in his back, said: "I had a really nice bath last night, got into bed and watched the golf in the States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0041	28	4335	4374	I'm a bit of a golf geek to be honest." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	0	58	104	South Ossetia poll set to bolster rebel leader 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	1	191	376	The party backing South Ossetia's leader Eduard Kokoity was on course Sunday to sweep legislative elections and tighten the grip of the strongman president on the Georgian rebel region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	2	386	612	Initial results showed Yedinstvo (Unity) well ahead in the vote in the mountainous rebel region that was the subject of a war last year between Moscow and Tbilisi and is recognised as independent by Russia and Nicaragua alone. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	3	622	851	The elections were marked by a sidelining of the local opposition who accuse Kokoity of seeking a loyal parliamentary majority to push through an amendment allowing him to run again for office when his second term lapses in 2011. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	4	861	1081	Based on an initial count of almost 61 percent of the vote, South Ossetia's central election commission said Unity had polled 48.04 percent while the People's Party, also largely uncritical of Kokoity, won 18.47 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	5	1091	1149	The Communists were second with 23.51 percent of the vote. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	6	1159	1256	Final results were due at 0600 GMT on Monday with officials estimating the turnout at 80 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	7	1266	1418	Only four parties are competing for the 34 seats in the parliament and the central election commission barred the only two parties not loyal to Kokoity. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	8	1428	1643	The name of Unity also bears more than a passing resemblance to Russia's ruling party Edinaya Rossiya (United Russia) and it even used pictures of United Russia party leader Boris Gryzlov on its campaign literature. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	9	1653	1866	But Russia -- which outraged the West by recognising South Ossetia as independent in the wake of the August war with Georgia -- has said South Ossetia should not amend the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	10	1876	2027	Kokoity said it was too early to say whether he planned to run again to lead the region of 50,000 people although he did not rule out that possibility. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	11	2037	2103	"There are two and half years left till then and a lot left to do. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	12	2104	2135	We are working and working now. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	13	2136	2202	I am not thinking about it yet," he said in an interview with AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	14	2212	2296	"With what happened in August we need three to four years to rebuild," Kokoity said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	15	2306	2368	Opposition activities said voting would not make a difference. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	16	2369	2392	"I plan to sit at home. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	17	2393	2502	There's nothing we can do," said Alan Gassiyev, an opposition leader, calling the polls "completely illegal." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	18	2512	2624	Critics accuse Kokoity, an ex-wrestling champion, of muzzling opponents and stealing the money sent from Russia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	19	2634	2862	As the reconstruction in the province stalled this winter, the opposition also accuses the separatist leader and his circle of diverting lorries carrying construction material and humanitarian aid to traffic the goods in Russia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	20	2872	2998	But despite the slow pace of reconstruction in the republic many praise Kokoity for his leadership during the August conflict. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	21	3008	3173	"Kokoity has done a lot for the people of South Ossetia, he's fought 20 years for this country," Angela Tedeyeva, a 32-year-old teacher, said as she cast her ballot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	22	3183	3371	Georgia ridiculed the vote, with the country's reintegration minister Temur Iakobashvili saying the elections were "nothing but clownery, a farce and a redistribution of a criminal power." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	23	3381	3524	But Kokoity insisted the elections were in strict accordance with law, saying the polls were "a maturity test for the small independent state." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	24	3534	3755	His domestic critics are concerned that the high number of polling stations  in the villages which were used to be populated by ethnic Georgians and which are now nearly empty will be used to falsify the election results. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	25	3765	3948	As the row over Kokoity's push for a third term threatens to become an embarrassment for Moscow, there are signs the Kremlin is scaling back its support for the South Ossetian leader. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	26	3958	4149	Sergey Naryshkin, the head of the Russian presidential administration, said on Russian television this month that South Ossetia should not change the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0042	27	4159	4332	Moscow and Tbilisi fought a brief but intense war last August over the region, which had enjoyed de facto independence since the early 1990s thanks to tacit Russian support.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	0	58	111	GM set for bankruptcy as Treasury readies rescue plan 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	1	189	396	The US Treasury Department on Sunday put final touches on a plan to restructure General Motors, once the world's largest automaker and now expected to join rival Chrysler in filing for bankruptcy protection. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	2	406	671	Monday will be a historic day for the US automobile industry, with  President Barack Obama poised to discuss General Motors' bankruptcy in remarks planned for 11:30 am (1530 GMT) Monday, after auto giant officially files its bankruptcy paperwork, US media reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	3	681	866	Meanwhile, GM's new chief executive, Fritz Henderson, has scheduled a news conference for the middle of the day in New York, where the number one US automaker would file for bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	4	876	1125	The US administration had given GM until June 1 to present a viable restructuring plan, in return for government aid, and the US Treasury Department had given holders of General Motors until the end of the day Saturday to respond to the rescue plan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	5	1135	1289	The plan was approved by holders of about 54 percent of the company's bond debt according to Elliot Sloane, spokesman for an ad hoc bondholders committee. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	6	1290	1379	Washington had warned that if the plan were rejected, creditors risked losing everything. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	7	1389	1627	Agreement boosted the Treasury's plan for creating a new company shorn of labor costs and money losing assets, in a rescue that could reach 60 billion dollars as the state takes a 72.5 per cent ownership stake in the 101 year old company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	8	1637	1740	Canada, which has several GM factories, is also set to be digging into its pockets for the rescue plan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	9	1750	1907	Among the backers was a committee of large investors holding about 20 percent of GM's 27.2 billion dollars in outstanding bonds, The New York Times reported. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	10	1917	2029	Under the plan, the bondholders would obtain the rights to buy an extra 15 percent of GM's stock at a low price. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	11	2030	2150	They would also control 25 percent of the new GM, after having supported the new company's creation in bankruptcy court. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	12	2160	2318	Bondholders who rejected the plan could still fight it in court, but the government maintains they could end up with little or nothing if they take that path. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	13	2328	2492	Meanwhile Monday New York bankruptcy judge Arthur Gonzales was set to rule on number three US automaker Chrysler, which filed for bankruptcy protection a month ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	14	2502	2671	Under an expedited process, Gonzales was expected to approve the creation of a new Chrysler that would preserve the automaker's healthiest assets and liquidate the rest. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	15	2681	2840	The new entity will be controlled by a consortium consisting of the Italian automaker Fiat, the United Auto Workers union, and the US and Canadian governments. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	16	2850	2997	Fiat will have a 20 percent stake with the option to increase it to 35 percent; the UAW 55 percent; and the US and Canadian governments 10 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	17	3007	3140	The automakers' fate, the subject of debate on television talks shows, is being closely watched in US political and economic circles. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	18	3150	3234	"This is a real sad day," said former Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	19	3244	3266	"I'm a son of Detroit. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	20	3267	3296	My dad was an auto executive. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	21	3297	3329	You know, I drive American cars. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	22	3330	3351	I love American cars. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	23	3352	3457	My heart bleeds for the people in Michigan and Detroit, for all these auto workers," he said on Fox News. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	24	3467	3575	At the end of last year, GM had 244,000 employees around the world, about half of them in the United States. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	25	3585	3774	Republican Mitch McConnell, the Senate minority leader, called the auto rescue plan "a big mistake," arguing that the government had done too much to keep GM and Chyrsler out of bankruptcy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	26	3784	3966	In an interview with CNN, he held up the example of Ford, the number two US automaker, as "an American company that hasn't taken government money and is still producing automobiles." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	27	3976	4077	Corporate leaders, meanwhile, urged the government not to overstay its welcome in the private sector. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	28	4087	4234	"I think all of us understand the need for the government to intervene and take the actions they did," said Anne Mulcahy, chief executive of Xerox. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	29	4235	4286	"But I also think there's a need for an exit plan." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	30	4296	4481	The possibility of bankruptcy for such an iconic American company has been viewed with great foreboding in a country where the automobile is deeply embedded in the national imagination. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0049	31	4491	4671	"The phrase 'bankrupt General Motors,' which we expect to hear uttered on Monay, leaves Americans my age in economic shock," the writer PJ O'Rourke said in the Wall Street Journal.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	0	58	120	Millvina Dean, last Titanic survivor, dies in England: reports 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	1	194	337	Millvina Dean, the last remaining survivor of the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, died in a care home in England on Sunday, media reports said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	2	338	349	She was 97. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	3	359	550	Elizabeth Gladys Dean, known to friends as Millvina, was only nine weeks old when the liner hit an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean on the night of April 14, 1912, and sank killing 1,500 people. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	4	560	628	She survived after being bundled up in a sack and carried to safety. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	5	629	744	Her mother Georgette Eva and brother Bertram also made it, but her father, Bertram Frank, was among those who died. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	6	754	922	Dean died in a private nursing home near Ashurst in the southern English county of Hampshire, according to the BBC and Britain's domestic Press Association news agency. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	7	923	966	Staff there refused to comment late Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	8	976	1113	Dean's family had boarded the Titanic at Southampton, heading for a new life in Kansas where her father hoped to open a tobacconist shop. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	9	1123	1191	Born on February 12, 1912, Dean was the youngest passenger on board. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	10	1192	1308	At the time, RMS Titanic was the most luxurious, most technically advanced and largest passenger liner in the world. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	11	1318	1496	She was dubbed "unsinkable", but it took just two hours and 40 minutes for her to disappear into the icy waters of the Atlantic after striking an iceberg at 11:40 pm on April 14. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	12	1506	1693	Dean was taken back to Southampton with her family after the disaster and did not find out that she had been on board until she was eight years old and her mother was planning to remarry. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	13	1703	1870	According to enthusiasts' website Encyclopedia Titanica (ET), Dean worked for the government as a cartographer during World War II and then for an engineering company. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	14	1880	2060	She told reporters that it was not until the wreckage of the liner was found in 1985 that she suddenly became a celebrity, taking part in documentaries and giving media interviews. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	15	2070	2302	Dean was invited to complete her family's ill-fated journey to the United States in 1997 aboard the QE2, and accepted, although she turned down an offer to attend the premier of the movie "Titanic" because it would be too upsetting. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	16	2312	2488	She moved into a private nursing home in Hampshire after breaking her hip three years ago, and after struggling to pay the bills was forced to sell off some of her memorabilia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	17	2498	2719	At auction in October 2008 she raised 31,150 pounds (40,000 euros, 53,900 dollars), selling off rare prints of the liner signed by the artists as well as compensation letters sent to her mother by the Titanic Relief Fund. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	18	2729	2888	Dean was also forced to sell a 100-year-old suitcase filled with clothes donated to her family by the people of New York when they arrived after being rescued. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	19	2898	3110	In the wake of the auction, friends including members of the British Titanic Society and the Belfast Titanic Society -- the liner was built in Belfast in Northern Ireland-- set up a campaign to secure her future. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	20	3120	3255	Among the donors to the Millvina Fund were Hollywood actors Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio, who starred in the 1997 "Titanic" film. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	21	3256	3351	The pair and the film's director, James Cameron, reportedly donated 30,000 US dollars in total. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	22	3361	3456	The last remaining US survivor, Lillian Asplund, died in her home in May 2006 at the age of 99. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0052	23	3457	3512	She was just five years old when the Titanic went down.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	1	176	330	The month of May witnessed 155 deaths from violence in Iraq, the fewest of any month since the US-led invasion in 2003, official figures showed on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	2	340	494	Statistics compiled by the defence, interior and health ministries showed that 124 civilians, six soldiers and 25 policemen were killed by attacks in May. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	3	504	571	People wounded included 285 civilians, four soldiers and 55 police. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	4	581	667	Some 40 presumed insurgents were killed and 904 arrested, according to the statistics. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	5	677	811	Deaths from violence fell by more than half from the 355 registered in April, which was the deadliest month since September last year. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	6	821	924	However, 24 US soldiers died in Iraq in May, up from 19 in April and the heaviest toll since September. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0060	7	934	1140	According to an AFP count based on the independent website icasualties.org, 4,306 American troops have been killed in Iraq since the 2003 invasion that ousted Saddam Hussein but sparked a deadly insurgency.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	0	58	104	South Ossetia poll set to bolster rebel leader 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	1	191	376	The party backing South Ossetia's leader Eduard Kokoity was on course Sunday to sweep legislative elections and tighten the grip of the strongman president on the Georgian rebel region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	2	386	612	Initial results showed Yedinstvo (Unity) well ahead in the vote in the mountainous rebel region that was the subject of a war last year between Moscow and Tbilisi and is recognized as independent by Russia and Nicaragua alone. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	3	622	851	The elections were marked by a sidelining of the local opposition who accuse Kokoity of seeking a loyal parliamentary majority to push through an amendment allowing him to run again for office when his second term lapses in 2011. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	4	861	1084	Based on an initial count of almost eight percent of the vote, South Ossetia's central election commission said Unity had polled 58.62 percent while the People's Party, also largely uncritical of Kokoity, won 20.35 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	5	1094	1150	The Communists were third with 14.6 percent of the vote. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	6	1151	1248	Final results were due at 0600 GMT on Monday with officials estimating the turnout at 80 percent. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	7	1258	1410	Only four parties are competing for the 34 seats in the parliament and the central election commission barred the only two parties not loyal to Kokoity. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	8	1420	1635	The name of Unity also bears more that a passing resemblance to Russia's ruling party Edinaya Rossiya (United Russia) and it even used pictures of United Russia party leader Boris Gryzlov on its campaign literature. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	9	1645	1858	But Russia -- which outraged the West by recognising South Ossetia as independent in the wake of the August war with Georgia -- has said South Ossetia should not amend the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	10	1868	2019	Kokoity said it was too early to say whether he planned to run again to lead the region of 50,000 people although he did not rule out that possibility. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	11	2029	2095	"There are two and half years left till then and a lot left to do. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	12	2096	2127	We are working and working now. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	13	2128	2194	I am not thinking about it yet," he said in an interview with AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	14	2204	2288	"With what happened in August we need three to four years to rebuild," Kokoity said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	15	2298	2360	Opposition activities said voting would not make a difference. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	16	2361	2384	"I plan to sit at home. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	17	2385	2494	There's nothing we can do," said Alan Gassiyev, an opposition leader, calling the polls "completely illegal." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	18	2504	2616	Critics accuse Kokoity, an ex-wrestling champion, of muzzling opponents and stealing the money sent from Russia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	19	2626	2854	As the reconstruction in the province stalled this winter, the opposition also accuses the separatist leader and his circle of diverting lorries carrying construction material and humanitarian aid to traffic the goods in Russia. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	20	2864	2990	But despite the slow pace of reconstruction in the republic many praise Kokoity for his leadership during the August conflict. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	21	3000	3165	"Kokoity has done a lot for the people of South Ossetia, he's fought 20 years for this country," Angela Tedeyeva, a 32-year-old teacher, said as she cast her ballot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	22	3175	3363	Georgia ridiculed the vote, with the country's reintegration minister Temur Iakobashvili saying the elections were "nothing but clownery, a farce and a redistribution of a criminal power." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	23	3373	3516	But Kokoity insisted the elections were in strict accordance with law, saying the polls were "a maturity test for the small independent state." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	24	3526	3747	His domestic critics are concerned that the high number of polling stations  in the villages which were used to be populated by ethnic Georgians and which are now nearly empty will be used to falsify the election results. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	25	3757	3940	As the row over Kokoity's push for a third term threatens to become an embarrassment for Moscow, there are signs the Kremlin is scaling back its support for the South Ossetian leader. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	26	3950	4141	Sergey Naryshkin, the head of the Russian presidential administration, said on Russian television this month that South Ossetia should not change the existing term limits in its constitution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0063	27	4151	4324	Moscow and Tbilisi fought a brief but intense war last August over the region, which had enjoyed de facto independence since the early 1990s thanks to tacit Russian support.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	0	58	100	Last Titanic survivor dies in England: BBC 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	1	174	331	Millvina Dean, the last remaining survivor of the sinking of the Titanic, died Sunday at a care home in England, the BBC reported, citing two of her friends. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	2	332	343	She was 97. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	3	353	543	Dean was a two-month-old baby and her family were emigrating to Kansas in the United States when the Titanic sank after hitting an iceberg in the Atlantic Ocean on its maiden voyage in 1912. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	4	553	600	She was placed in a sack and carried to safety. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	5	601	703	Her mother and brother also survived, but her father was among the 1,500 passengers and crew who died. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	6	713	821	Two of Dean's unnamed friends told the BBC that she died at the care home in Hampshire, in southern England. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	7	822	925	She had spent most of her life in Southampton in the county of Hampton, from where the Titanic set out. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	8	935	1106	Dean had been struggling to pay the bills for her care home and in October 2008 raised 31,150 pounds (40,000 euros, 53,900 dollars) by auctioning off items from the liner. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	9	1116	1300	She was forced to sell a 100-year-old suitcase filled with clothes which was donated to her family by the people of New York when they arrived in the United States after being rescued. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	10	1310	1492	Rare prints of the liner signed by the artists along with compensation letters sent to her mother by the Titanic Relief Fund also went under the hammer in Devizes, southwest England. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	11	1502	1597	The last remaining US survivor, Lillian Asplund, died in her home in May 2006 at the age of 99. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0075	12	1598	1653	She was just five years old when the Titanic went down.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	0	58	111	Football: Sad exit for Jose as Ahly stunned in Angola 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	1	191	367	Manuel Jose ended his title-strewn career as Al-Ahly coach disastrously when the Egyptian giants were dumped out of the African Confederation Cup by Santos in Angola on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	2	377	598	Ahly, winners of the African Champions League a record six times, took a 3-0 lead into the return match and even the absence of star midfielder Mohamed Aboutraika was not expected to prevent them reaching the group phase. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	3	608	801	But a Santos team competing in Africa for the first time this year had other ideas and triumphed 3-0 in Luanda to level the aggregate score before winning the fourth-round tie 6-5 on penalties.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	14	2456	2686	Ahly have campaigned in Africa regularly since 1975 and this was only the fourth time they had suffered a three-goal loss, with Mouloudia Alger of Algeria, Hearts of Oak of Ghana and Al-Hilal of Sudan inflicting the other defeats. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0079	15	2696	2893	The heavy reverses against Mouloudia and Hearts came three decades ago while Hilal triumphed two years ago in Omdurman against a club that claims 40 million supporters in Egypt and the Middle East.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	2	366	487	The 54 percent represented 975 institutions, a spokesman for the ad hoc committee of bondholders, Elliot Sloane told AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	3	497	662	The Treasury had given the bondholders until the end of the day Saturday to respond to its proposal to create a new company and shed assets that were causing losses. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	4	672	884	The creditors collectively would receive 10 percent of GM's stock in return for their shares, and warrants, or options to buy stock, allowing them to acquire up to an additional 15 percent of the company's stock. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	5	894	1114	If the options are exercised, they would control up to 25 percent of the "new GM," while the Treasury would at least initially hold a 72.5 percent stake in the company that emerges from a bankruptcy court reorganization. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	6	1124	1205	Bondholders who rejected the plan account for about 46 percent of GM's bond debt. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	7	1206	1327	They can contest it in court and try to get as much of what they are owed as they can through the bankruptcy proceedings. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	8	1337	1431	The government has warned that they may end up with little or nothing if they take that route. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0090	9	1441	1547	Once the world's biggest auto company, General Motors was poised Sunday to file for bankruptcy protection.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	0	58	120	French physicists claim breakthrough in ultra-fast data access 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	1	193	400	French physicists said on Sunday they had used ultra-fast lasers that could accelerate storage and retrieval of data on hard discs by up to 100,000 times, pointing the way to a new generation of IT wizardry. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	2	410	610	The research builds on achievements that earned the 2007 Nobel physics prize for Albert Fert of France and Peter Gruenberg of Germany, who ushered in a revolution in miniaturised storage in the 1990s. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	3	620	721	Fert and Gruenberg discovered that tiny changes in magnetic fields can yield a large electric output. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	4	731	881	These differences in turn cause changes in the current in the readout head that scans a hard disk to spot the ones and zeroes in which data is stored. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	5	891	1106	That discovery opened the way to "spintronics", a form of electronics that uses not only electrical charge but also the spin of electrons in individual atoms to provide a more compact, denser storage on hard drives. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	6	1116	1228	But reading and writing data through spintronics has been hampered by the relative slowness of magnetic sensors. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	7	1238	1532	In a study published in the specialist journal Nature Physics, a team led by Jean-Yves Bigot of the Institute of Materials Physics and Chemistry in Strasbourg employed a "femtosecond" laser, using ultra-fast bursts of laser light, to alter electron spin and thus speed up retrieval and storage. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	8	1542	1724	"Our method is called the photonics of spin, because it is photons [particles of light] that modify the state of the electrons' magnetisation" on the storage surface, Bigot told AFP. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	9	1734	1832	Data is retrieved with a burst that lasts just a millionth of a billionth of a second, said Bigot. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	10	1842	2013	Femtosecond lasers currently measure around 30 centimetres (12 inches) by 10 centimetres (four inches) which means they are too big for consumer electronics, he cautioned. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	11	2023	2117	Bigot added, though, that their miniaturisation is likely to be achieved over the next decade. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0126	12	2127	2218	IBM, Hitachi and other corporations are "extremely interested" by the research, Bigot said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	0	58	99	First genes spotted for testicular cancer 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	1	172	348	Scientists in Britain said Sunday they had found the first genes that are associated with testicular cancer, the commonest form of cancer for men between the ages of 15 and 45. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	2	358	573	Telltale variants in chromosomes 5, 6 and 12 are linked with an increased risk of the disease, according to their study, which compared the genetic code of 730 men who had testicular cancer with that of healthy men. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	3	583	706	Inheriting the basket of three factors boosts the risk of the cancer, called testicular gem cell tumour, by up to fourfold. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	4	716	777	The study is published online in the journal Nature Genetics. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	5	787	1097	"We have known for some time that men whose father, brothers or sons had testicular cancer are much more likely to get it themselves and we have been searching for this genetic link," said one of the investigators, Elizabeth Rapley of the Institute of Cancer Research, in the southern English county of Surrey. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	6	1107	1211	"We believe there are more (risk factors) still to be found and we are working on identifying the rest." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	7	1221	1328	The three telltales lie near genes that nurture testicular cells which are precursors in sperm development. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	8	1338	1516	Worldwide incidence of testicular cancer is 7.5 cases per 100,000 men, but the rates vary remarkably between countries and according to ancestry, the ICR said in a press release. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	9	1526	1552	Why this is so is unclear. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	10	1553	1657	Inheritance, though, is a well-known risk factor and seems to be far higher than for other cancer types. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	11	1667	1867	Studies have found that the risk to brothers of testicular cancer patients is eight to 10 times higher than the general population, while for fathers of patients, the risk is four to six times higher. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0127	12	1877	1961	Testicular cancer is 99 percent curable if caught in its early stages, the ICR said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0128	0	58	115	Football: Perez could take charge again of Real on Monday

AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	0	58	122	Tennis: Nadal five-title dream crushed by Soderling sledgehammer 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	1	195	360	Rafael Nadal's hopes of a record fifth successive French Open title were crushed into the Roland Garros red dust by Robin Soderling's Swedish sledgehammer on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	2	370	555	In one of the greatest upsets in the history of the tournament, the Spanish king of clay slumped to a first ever defeat here having racked up 31 wins in 31 outings since his 2005 debut. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	3	565	788	Soderling's stunning 6-2, 6-7 (2/7), 6-4, 7-6 (7/2) fourth round victory came just a month after he'd won only one game in a 6-1, 6-0 rout at the Rome Masters, his third defeat in three matches against the world number one. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	4	798	1010	But he was a man transformed on Sunday with the 24-year-old unleashing a formidable service game and a relentless, pinpoint accurate forehand which forced Nadal to constantly scramble for a foothold in the match. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	5	1020	1198	"He didn't surprise me because I know how he plays and how dangerous he can be," said Nadal who had won the Monte Carlo, Rome and Barcelona events in the run-up to Roland Garros. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	6	1208	1231	"I didn't play my best. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	7	1232	1274	I played very short and I couldn't attack. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	8	1275	1319	I made it easy for him to play at his level. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	9	1320	1331	But I lost. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	10	1341	1384	"It's not a tragedy, I had to lose one day. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	11	1385	1466	I must accept my defeats with the same level of calm that I accept my victories." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	12	1476	1510	Soderling was in tears by the end. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	13	1520	1643	"I just couldn't believe it when I won that last point," said the Swede who has never gone this far before in a Grand Slam. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	14	1653	1677	"I'm so proud of myself. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	15	1678	1775	This is the best win of my career against a man who is the greatest claycourt player in history." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	16	1785	1938	Nadal's first set loss was the first time he had dropped a set in the tournament since the 2007 final against Roger Federer, ending a run of 32 in a row. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	17	1948	2142	The Spaniard was reeling from the outset at the hands of a man whom he'd accused of being one of the most unpopular players in the locker room after an acrimonious Wimbledon clash two years ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	18	2152	2358	Nadal was broken in the fourth game as 23rd seeded Soderling went to 4-1 ahead and again in the crucial eighth as the free-flowing, uninhibited Swede continued to find the corners with devastating accuracy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	19	2368	2455	The 24-year-old deservedly claimed the opening set when the champion netted a backhand. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	20	2465	2650	Nadal, despite missing his usual fluency and rattled by the unrelenting assault, broke for the first time to lead 2-1 in the second set only to surrender his advantage in the 10th game. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	21	2660	2814	With most people inside Court Philippe Chatrier expecting a Nadal drive to fly past the big Swede, Soderling executed a fine backhand volley to go to 5-5. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	22	2824	2970	Despite those heroics, Nadal ran away with the tiebreaker to level the match when, for once, Soderling's forehand missed its target and flew long. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	23	2980	3143	The Swede, coached by compatriot and 2000 finalist Magnus Norman, refused to yield, breaking to lead 4-3 before backing it up for a 5-3 advantage in the third set. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	24	3153	3247	He took the set when Nadal netted another weary forehand off yet another deep Soderling drive. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	25	3257	3470	Nadal broke to lead 2-0 in the fourth set, but Soderling hit back immediately as another tiebreak loomed where the gallant Swede clinched his famous win on a second match point when Nadal went wide with a pick-up. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	26	3480	3576	Soderling sent down nine aces in the match and fired a decisive 61 winners to the Spaniard's 33. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0131	27	3586	3739	His reward is a match-up with either Russian 10th seed Nikolay Davydenko or Fernando Verdasco, the eighth-seeded Spaniard for a place in the semi-finals.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	0	58	119	Motorcycling: Stoner ends Rossi's seven year reign at Mugello 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	1	203	358	Casey Stoner held off the fast-finishing Jorge Lorenzo to win the Italian Grand Prix on Sunday and bring to an end Valentino Rossi's seven-year reign here. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	2	368	542	The Australian also took over the lead in the world championship standings with his second win of the season having also triumphed in Qatar in the opening race of the season. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	3	552	690	He now leads Lorenzo, who started on pole here, by four points in the championship standings with Rossi third, a further five points back. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	4	700	834	In a dramatic race that began in wet conditions, Stoner seized the advantage when switching bikes after 10 laps for a change of tyres. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	5	844	1019	"Once I got onto the slicks I found a good feeling immediately and I was able to get to the front quite quickly, but then I started having a problem with the clutch," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	6	1029	1087	"It was a really hard race and I just wanted to finish it. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	7	1088	1191	I just tried to stay smooth and keep the same lap times even if I couldn’t ride the way I wanted to." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	8	1201	1427	He was the fastest man on the track by some margin in those first few laps after the switch and although Yamaha pair Lorenzo and Rossi were quickest at the end, they had both lost too much time and too many places to hit back. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	9	1437	1537	Rossi blamed his team for making the wrong choice of tyre in the dry, going for the harder compound. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	10	1547	1607	"It's a precious result, it's also nice to be on the podium. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	11	1608	1687	The race was really difficult, we knew the weather would be terrible," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	12	1697	1756	"In the dry we made a mistake in going with the hard tyres. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	13	1757	1822	The choice of hards was made even though I wanted the soft ones." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	14	1832	1938	Lorenzo said he was delighted with his finish having slid off on the warm-up lap and skidded at the start. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	15	1948	2064	"Honestly, this is as good as a win for me and I can't really believe the race today, it was like a movie," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	16	2074	2207	"It's a really amazing result because things could have been much worse today, so thank you again to everyone for making it possible. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	17	2208	2243	I'm really happy with this result." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	18	2253	2339	Stoner completed the 23 laps in 45min 41.894sec to beat Lorenzo by just over a second. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	19	2349	2458	In an exciting race the pole-sitter got off to a terrible start in the wet and immediately dropped to eighth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	20	2468	2665	Quickest off the mark were Australian Chris Vermeulen, who started 11th, and Andrea Dovizioso, who began seventh but Stoner passed them both on the long straight at the beginning of the second lap. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	21	2675	2786	Vermeulen quickly started heading backwards, eventually finishing 10th, as Rossi started to move up from fifth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	22	2796	2903	However Italian Marco Melandri on a Kawasaki, who started 15th on the grid, was clearly fastest in the wet. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	23	2913	3042	Rossi took the lead from Dovizioso, who had got back past Stoner, on the seventh lap and two laps later he lost that to Melandri. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	24	3052	3201	However, on the 10th lap all the front runners came into the pits for a change of bikes and when they came out, Stoner was quickest to find his pace. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	25	3211	3388	Melandri immediately started heading backwards, eventually finishing 11th and 35sec back, while Loris Capirossi propelled himself into race contention with Stoner and Dovizioso. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	26	3398	3603	Lorenzo and Rossi initially struggled with their bikes down in fifth and sixth and the time they lost over those first three laps coming out of the pits essentially cost either of them a chance of victory. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	27	3613	3832	While Stoner had soon taken the race lead, both Yamaha riders had to then pass Melandri, Capirossi and Dovizioso and by the time they had done so, Stoner was over a second ahead and with only a couple of laps remaining. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	28	3842	4021	Meanwhile former Superbikes champion James Toseland of Britain got his best finish of the season in seventh, benefitting from being the first man into the pits to change his bike. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0135	29	4031	4203	It meant that his tyres were warm and he was flying as the fastest man on track for a few laps when everyone else was simply trying to get temperature into their new tyres.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	1	178	343	Rafael Nadal's hopes of a record fifth successive French Open title were crushed into the Roland Garros red dust by Robin Soderling's Swedish sledgehammer on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	2	353	533	In one of the greatest upsets in the tournament's history, the Spanish king of clay slumped to a first ever defeat here having racked up 31 wins in 31 outings since his 2005 debut. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	3	543	753	Soderling's stunning 6-2, 6-7 (2/7), 6-4, 7-6 (7/2) victory came just a month after he'd won only one game in a 6-1, 6-0 rout at the Rome Masters, his third defeat in three matches against the world number one. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	4	763	973	But he was man transformed on Sunday with the 24-year-old unleashing a formidable service game and a relentless, pinpoint accurate forehand which forced Nadal to constantly scramble for a foothold in the match. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	5	983	1116	"I just couldn't believe it when I won that last point," said a tearful Soderling who has never gone this far before in a Grand Slam.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	10	1491	1685	The Spaniard was reeling from the outset at the hands of a man whom he'd accused of being one of the most unpopular players in the locker room after an acrimonious Wimbledon clash two years ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	11	1695	1901	Nadal was broken in the fourth game as 23rd seeded Soderling went to 4-1 ahead and again in the crucial eighth as the free-flowing, uninhibited Swede continued to find the corners with devastating accuracy. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	12	1911	1998	The 24-year-old deservedly claimed the opening set when the champion netted a backhand. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	13	2008	2193	Nadal, despite missing his usual fluency and rattled by the unrelenting assault, broke for the first time to lead 2-1 in the second set only to surrender his advantage in the 10th game. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	14	2203	2357	With most people inside Court Philippe Chatrier expecting a Nadal drive to fly past the big Swede, Soderling executed a fine backhand volley to go to 5-5. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	15	2367	2513	Despite those heroics, Nadal ran away with the tiebreaker to level the match when, for once, Soderling's forehand missed its target and flew long. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	16	2523	2686	The Swede, coached by compatriot and 2000 finalist Magnus Norman, refused to yield, breaking to lead 4-3 before backing it up for a 5-3 advantage in the third set. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	17	2696	2790	He took the set when Nadal netted another weary forehand off yet another deep Soderling drive. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	18	2800	3013	Nadal broke to lead 2-0 in the fourth set, but Soderling hit back immediately as another tiebreak loomed where the gallant Swede clinched his famous win on a second match point when Nadal went wide with a pick-up. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	19	3023	3119	Soderling sent down nine aces in the match and fired a decisive 61 winners to the Spaniard's 33. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0148	20	3129	3282	His reward is a match-up with either Russian 10th seed Nikolay Davydenko or Fernando Verdasco, the eighth-seeded Spaniard for a place in the semi-finals.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	18	2229	2315	Stoner completed the 23 laps in 45min 41.894sec to beat Lorenzo by just over a second. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	19	2325	2434	In an exciting race the pole-sitter got off to a terrible start in the wet and immediately dropped to eighth. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	20	2444	2641	Quickest off the mark were Australian Chris Vermeulen, who started 11th, and Andrea Dovizioso, who began seventh but Stoner passed them both on the long straight at the beginning of the second lap.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	24	3028	3177	However, on the 10th lap all the front runners came into the pits for a change of bikes and when they came out, Stoner was quickest to find his pace. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	25	3187	3364	Melandri immediately started heading backwards, eventually finishing 11th and 35sec back, while Loris Capirossi propelled himself into race contention with Stoner and Dovizioso. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0152	26	3374	3580	Lorenzo and Rossi initially struggled with their bikes down in fifth and sixth and the time they lost over those first three laps coming out of the pits, essentially cost either of them a chance of victory.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	0	58	118	ICRC 'gravely concerned' at Pakistan's Swat Valley situation 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	1	192	379	Senior Red Cross officials who visited Pakistan's Swat Valley said Sunday they were "gravely concerned" over the humanitarian situation as Pakistani soldiers battled to crush the Taliban. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	2	389	665	"The organisation is gravely concerned about the plight of civilians in Swat and believes their situation demands a prompt and comprehensive humanitarian response," said a statement released from the Geneva headquarters of the International Committee for the Red Cross (ICRC). 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	3	675	810	"The ICRC will do its utmost to meet those needs without delay," said Pascal Cuttat, head of the organisation's delegation in Pakistan. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	4	820	1004	"Given what we have already seen on the ground, we are mobilising additional resources, but safe and unimpeded access to the area remains essential for our teams to deliver," he added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	5	1014	1226	Aid workers had been alarmed at what they saw when they entered the region, where the fighting between the Pakistani army and Taliban fighters for the pass month has left civilians trapped and isolated for weeks. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	6	1236	1361	"There is no running water, no electricity, and food is scarce," said Daniel O'Malley, who led the IRCR team into the region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	7	1371	1517	"Phone lines are down, so people have been cut off from the outside world and are anxious for contact with relatives who fled the area," he added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	8	1527	1667	Red Cross workers were also disturbed at conditions in Khwazakhela hospital, one of the few medical facilities still left operating in Swat. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	9	1677	1795	"The handful of hospital staff left are struggling to work without any water, electricity or supplies," said O'Malley. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	10	1805	1859	"They simply cannot cope with the influx of patients." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	11	1869	1923	The Red Cross evacuated 14 patients from the hospital. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	12	1933	2066	Pakistan's defence secretary Syed Athar Ali said Sunday the army was gaining on the Taliban and fighting could be over in a few days. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	13	2076	2266	Swat valley's main town Mingora is back in government hands, a critical milestone in an offensive launched after the Taliban thrust to within 100 kilometres (60 miles) of Islamabad in April. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	14	2276	2405	The defence chief told a security forum in Singapore that three targeted northwest districts were almost clear of Taliban rebels. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	15	2415	2566	"Only five to 10 percent of the job is remaining and hopefully within the next two to three days these pockets of resistance will be cleared," he said. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	16	2576	2709	The United States, which is firmly backing the current military drive, had warned that the rebels threaten Pakistan's very existence. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	17	2719	2889	Also Sunday the military relaxed a curfew Sunday in most parts of the northwest including Mingora to allow people trapped on the roads to return home or leave the region. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	18	2899	3063	The ICRC is one of the very few humanitarian organizations working in Swat before the conflict broke out and has been trying to return there since early this month. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	19	3064	3155	Despite some openings it said access to areas affected by the fighting remains too limited. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0154	20	3165	3328	It also continues to support camps run by the Pakistan Red Crescent Society, where over 20,000 people driven from their homes by the fighting are currently living.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	0	58	109	Tennis: Azarenka dethrones Queen Ana at French Open 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	1	182	346	Belarussian teenager Victoria Azarenka sunk Ana Ivanovic's hopes of defending her French Open crown with a comprehensive 6-2, 6-3 win in the fourth round on Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	2	356	523	It is the first time the 19-year-old has reached the last eight at a Grand Slam event and she will play Russian top seed Dinara Safina for a place in the semi- finals. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	3	533	690	The 21-year-old Ivanovic, meanwhile, was left pondering what she has to do to re-discover the form that brought her the title and world No.1 spot a year ago. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	4	700	843	Azarenka, with three titles to her name this year already, was the first to break thanks to a blistering crosscourt backhand in the third game. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	5	853	1010	Ivanovic, who has battled for form and fitness since her triumph here last year, had her chances to break back in the following game but failed to take them. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	6	1020	1202	She paid the penalty for that three games later when Azarenka collected a second break of serve forcing her opponent to hit long on break point at the end of a long, punishing rally. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	7	1212	1321	Azarenka, a former world junior No.1, comfortably served out for the set despite opening with a double fault. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	8	1331	1509	Both players were wearing high-tech strapping on their knees, the right for Ivanovic and the left for Azarenko, a clear sign of the injury epidemic that has beset women's tennis. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	9	1519	1711	Ivanovic was put under severe pressure on her serve again at the start of the second set and after saving a handful of break points she finally succumbed by hitting a forehand a fraction long. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	10	1721	1865	That was all Azarenka needed to further assert her authority in the match with Ivanovic looking increasingly out of sorts and unsure of herself. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	11	1875	1990	The crowd were firmly behind the Serb, but it made no difference as Azarenko jumped out into a commanding 4-0 lead. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	12	2000	2169	Ivanovic did manage to claw two games back to get to 4-2, but Azarenka snuffed out any hope she had of a comeback by breaking the Serbian's serve again in the next game. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0173	13	2179	2304	She failed to serve out for the match but broke Ivanovic for the sixth time in the match in the following game to go through.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	1	194	389	Cuba has agreed to resume talks with the United States on migration and direct mail, a US official said here Sunday, as a US-Cuban thaw gathers pace under President Barack Obama's administration. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	2	399	667	The announcement came as Secretary of State Hillary Clinton prepared to attend Tuesday's Organization of American States (OAS) general assembly in Honduras, where Washington and its southern neighbors have been caught in a row over the pace of normalization with Cuba. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	3	677	779	The Cuban government informed Washington on Saturday that it "would like to resume migration talks.... 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	4	780	909	(and) engage in talks on direct mail service," the senior State Department official told reporters on the condition of anonymity. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	5	919	1004	"We and the Cubans have to determine a mutually convenient place and time," he added. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	6	1014	1211	The official said the Cubans "also indicated they would like to explore areas of additional dialogue," such as in counter-narcotics, counter-terrorism, hurricane and disaster preparedness response. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	7	1221	1440	US officials said May 23 that the Obama administration had proposed to resume the discussions on migration issues, which had been conducted every two years until they were suspended in 2003 by former president George W. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	8	1441	1446	Bush. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	9	1456	1656	It was also Washington that recently proposed to resume direct mail, the official said, adding mail has for years, if not decades, been sent between the United States and Cuba through a third country. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	10	1666	1847	The official called the moves a "very positive development and step forward" as the Obama administration pursues engagement with Cuba, which has been under a decades-old US embargo. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	11	1857	1982	He said diplomatic notes were handed to US officials by Jorge Bolanos, the head of the Cuban interests section in Washington. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	12	1992	2063	Cuba has a longstanding interest in seeing migration dialogue progress. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	13	2064	2208	The Caribbean nation of more than 11 million is bothered by embarrassing illegal emigration by Cubans across the shark-infested Florida Straits. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	14	2218	2381	Havana, the Americas' only one-party communist regime, has long argued the United States should increase its number of standard legal immigration visas for Cubans. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	15	2391	2616	Since coming to office in January, the Obama administration has called past US policy a failure and moved to repair ties with Cuban President Raul Castro, who officially took over the reins from older brother Fidel last year. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	16	2626	2730	In April, Obama lifted travel and money transfer restrictions on Cuban-Americans with relatives in Cuba. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	17	2740	2923	When asked if the announcement would affect the OAS meeting on Tuesday in San Pedro Sula, the official said "it is hoped that this will be understood in the region in a positive way." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	18	2933	3147	US officials earlier declined to even rule out the possibility of Clinton's skipping the OAS meeting altogether if negotiators fail to agree on terms for bringing Cuba back within the 35-member organization's fold. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	19	3157	3377	The United States wants Cuba to free political prisoners and respect political freedoms for it to participate fully in the OAS, saying Havana should be held to the democratic principles enshrined in the 2001 OAS charter. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	20	3387	3486	Other OAS members say that Cuba can be nudged toward democracy once part of the international body. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	21	3496	3713	Since a popular Obama took office in January, he has raised hopes among many of his southern neighbors that he will soon lift the controversial embargo, even if he insists that Cuba first undertake democratic reforms. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	22	3723	3891	"This is going to be a complicated challenge for her (Clinton) to deal with," said Michael Shifter, an analyst for the Inter-American Dialogue, a Washington think tank.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	24	3953	4018	I think they're aware that it's a minefield, Cuba," said Shifter. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0183	25	4028	4170	Clinton was preparing to leave Sunday for El Salvador to attend Monday's inauguration of Mauricio Funes, the first stop on a two-country tour.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	1	192	372	Nearly 600 symbols of the right-wing dictatorship of General Francisco Franco still adorn public buildings in Spain more than 30 years after his death, a newspaper reported Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	2	382	596	More than half of the remaining 585 symbols of the regime are on defence ministry buildings as many military leaders are reluctant to have them removed, said the daily newspaper Publico, citing a government report. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	3	606	834	Under a law passed in 2007 by the governing Socialists, towns are obliged to remove public symbols of the Franco era and rename streets named after the dictator or the generals who fought with him in Spain's 1936-1939 civil war. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	4	844	977	But it allows for exceptions to be made if valid artistic, historical or religious reasons are given for a symbol to remain in place. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	5	987	1161	The government report cited by Publico was drawn up to determine which symbols of the regime should be "removed, hidden or neutralised" and which should be allowed to remain. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	6	1171	1294	The Franco symbols that remain are mostly depictions of the coat of arms of the regime, which include the Eagle of St John. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	7	1304	1460	The last public statue of Franco still on display on mainland Spain was taken down from a central square in the northern city of Santander in December 2008. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0189	8	1470	1617	Franco ruled Spain with an iron fist from 1939 until his death in 1975 at the age of 82, which paved the way for the country's return to democracy.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0193	2	363	569	"We must overcome this phase with all its ramifications and open a new page to build the nation," the emir, Sheikh Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah, told the new parliament which was elected on May 16 in snap polls.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0193	4	750	918	Sheikh Sabah said that the cornerstone for forging ahead with stalled development programmes is through a strong cooperation between the government and the legislature.

AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	0	58	106	London's Big Ben ticks over to 150th anniversary 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	1	180	290	Big Ben, arguably the world's most famous clock which towers over London, marked its 150th anniversary Sunday. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	2	300	456	The clock started ticking on May 31 1859 and has continued with only occasional interruptions for maintenance, bad weather and even bird strikes ever since. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	3	466	640	The clock, housed in St Stephen's Tower which adjoins Britain's House of Commons, is one of the capital's most popular tourist attractions and boasts some amazing statistics. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	4	650	805	Each of the four Gothic clock faces is seven metres wide, with a minute hand over four metres long which travels the equivalent of 190 kilometres per year. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	5	815	975	A Latin inscription is carved beneath each one -- "Domine salvam fac Reginam nostrum Victoriam primam" which means: "O Lord, save our Queen Victoria the First." 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	6	976	1032	Queen Victoria was on the throne in Britain at the time. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	7	1042	1231	The 96 metre-high tower which houses the clock was built as part of the rebuilding of the Houses of Parliament by architects Charles Barry and Augustus Pugin following a major fire in 1843. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	8	1241	1355	A competition was opened in 1846 to decide who should build the clock, but it took seven years to decide a winner. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	9	1365	1570	Eventually, the winner was named as Edward Dent, who had already made a chronometer for the HMS Beagle, the ship which carried Charles Darwin on a worldwide voyage which led him to the theory of evolution. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	10	1580	1720	The clock cost 2,500 pounds to build and was completed in 1854 but it was not installed until the clock tower was finished five years later. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	11	1730	1865	Even then, there was a last-minute hitch -- the original cast-iron minute hands were too heavy and had to be replaced with copper ones. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	12	1875	2034	The famous bell chimes -- which are used at the start of many television and radio news bulletins in Britain -- did not sound for another six weeks afterwards. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	13	2044	2172	The name Big Ben originally referred to the bell in the clocktower, but has come to be used for the tower and the clock as well. 
AFP_ENG_20090531.0195	14	2182	2366	It is not entirely clear where the name Big Ben comes from -- some say refers to Sir Benjamin Hall, an MP at the time, while others claim it was after heavyweight boxer Benjamin Caunt.
